content.description:
A local classic with incredible movement and flow.

Sit start on the right side of the boulder on the two shallow pockets as for "Pop a Tendon". Pull on and make a huge move to a good gaston hold. Reel in the gaston and match before continuing left to the corner of the boulder and using some foot trickery to use some poor holds and execute a fun party trick move to a jug on "Carrot Top". From here muster together whatever is left in the tank and head left and finish with the classic desperate finishing move of "Sucker Punch".

The two slot holds used on "East Easy Rider" are not used in this route.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter

content.description: Start at Sucker Punch, traverse right around arete with tricky but good feet, continue right through good holds, finish up at the right side of boulder

Start at the good incut flake.   Move up left to a crimp and match on this.   Aim for the lip and launch up to it.

Very short, but a fun problem.
content.location: Leftmost problem on the North face.

content.description: The obvious dyne problem to the right of East Easy Rider. Start in the two pockets or with the left on the crimp above and all out dyno to the big hueco up and right. A good dyno that did not make it into the book....Instead there is a description for a broken problem that no longer goes, or goes very hard and un-fun. Other variations exist from this start, including one that goes left into E.E.R.
content.protection: A few pads, the rock behind menaces but is not much of an issue.

content.description:
Sit start underneath the overhang.

Make a hard move to gain the well chalked slot.   From here traverse left to finish as for

Carrot Top

.
Start at the bottom of the crimp rail and traverse left before heading up.
content.location: On the smaller boulder forming a cove with the Fred Boulder. This problem starts at the end of the rail to the right of Pop a Tendon.

content.description:
Start at the same good flake as

Sucker Punch

.

Traverse right on good incuts until possible to move up the blunt arete.   Make hard moves to top out the arete.
content.location: Left side of the North face.
